00020 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00021 // Handler for the FPGA state change interrupt
00022 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00023 void ISR_FPGA( void )
00024 {
00025     // Disable interrupt until interrupt is handled and enabled again (in some task).
00026     //
00027     AT91F_AIC_DisableIt( AT91C_BASE_AIC, AT91C_ID_IRQ0 );
00028     
00029     portBASE_TYPE isTaskWokenByPost = pdFALSE;
00030     
00031     if ( fpgaEvent.ReleaseFromISR( 1, isTaskWokenByPost ) )
00032     {
00033         isTaskWokenByPost = pdTRUE;
00034         }
00035 
00036     // Acknowledge the interrupt
00037     //
00038     AT91F_AIC_AcknowledgeIt( AT91C_BASE_AIC );
00039 
00040     // If an event caused a task to unblock then we call "Yield from ISR" to ensure 
00041     // that the unblocked task is the task that executes when the interrupt completes
00042     // if the unblocked task has a priority higher than the interrupted task.
00043     //
00044     if( isTaskWokenByPost )
00045         portYIELD_FROM_ISR ();
00046     }
00047 
00048 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00049 // FC Bus Command
00050 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00051 bool FPGA_FC_Command( uint cmd )
00052 {
00053     uchar FCD[ 8 ];
00054     for ( int i = 0; i < 8; i ++ )
00055     {
00056         FCD[ i ] = ( cmd & 0x80 ) ? XPI_FC_FCD : 0;
00057         cmd <<= 1;
00058         }
00059 
00060     taskENTER_CRITICAL ();
00061 
00062     FPGA_BegWrite ();
00063     FPGA_Write( XPI_W_PAGE_ADDR, 0 ); // Page 0
00064     FPGA_Write( XPI_W_P0_FC_CONTROL, 0x00 ); // FCC, FCD, FCE = 0
00065 
00066     for ( int i = 0; i < 8; i++ )
00067     {
00068         FPGA_Write( XPI_W_P0_FC_CONTROL, FCD[ i ] ); // FCD with FCC = 0
00069         FCD[ i ] |= XPI_FC_FCC;
00070         FPGA_Write( XPI_W_P0_FC_CONTROL, FCD[ i ] ); // FCD with FCC = 1
00071         }
00072 
00073     FPGA_Write( XPI_W_P0_FC_CONTROL, XPI_FC_FCE ); // FCE = 1, FCC = 0
00074 
00075     FPGA_BegRead ();
00076     cmd = FPGA_Read( XPI_R_P0_FC_STATUS );
00077 
00078     FPGA_BegWrite ();
00079     FPGA_Write( XPI_W_P0_FC_CONTROL, 0x00 ); // FCE = 0
00080 
00081     taskEXIT_CRITICAL ();
00082 
00083     return ( cmd & XPI_FC_SENSE ) != 0; // Return SENSE
00084     }

00087 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00088 // FPGA I/O Profiling
00089 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00090 //    Cycle     Speed     Cycle w/o Loop   Instructions in Loop
00091 //  --------- ----------  ---------------  ----------------------------
00092 //   253 ns   31.57 Mbps        0 ns        NOP;
00093 //   781 ns   10.24 Mbps      528 ns        Write;
00094 //   971 ns    8.23 Mbps      718 ns        BegWrite; Write; BegRead;
00095 //   802 ns    9.97 Mbps      549 ns        Read;
00096 //  1.27 us    6.32 Mbps     1013 ns        BegWrite; Write; BegRead; Read;
00097 //  1.18 us    7.15 Mbps      865 ns        BegWrite; Write; Write; BegRead;
00098 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00099 
00100 static void FPGA_Profile( void )
00101 {
00102     long N = 10000000;
00103     
00104     TRACE_INFO( "T0\n" );
00105     FPGA_BegWrite ();
00106     for ( long i = 0; i < N; i++ )
00107     {
00108         asm volatile ( "NOP" );
00109         }
00110     
00111     TRACE_INFO( "T1\n" );
00112     FPGA_BegWrite ();
00113     for ( long i = 0; i < N; i++ )
00114     {
00115         asm volatile ( "NOP" );
00116         FPGA_Write( i, i );
00117         }
00118     
00119     TRACE_INFO( "T2\n" );
00120     for ( long i = 0; i < N; i++ )
00121     {
00122         asm volatile ( "NOP" );
00123         FPGA_BegWrite ();
00124         FPGA_Write( i, i );
00125         FPGA_BegRead ();
00126         }
00127     
00128     TRACE_INFO( "T3\n" );
00129     FPGA_BegRead ();
00130     for ( long i = 0; i < N; i++ )
00131     {
00132         asm volatile ( "NOP" );
00133         (void volatile) FPGA_Read( i );
00134         }
00135 
00136     TRACE_INFO( "T4\n" );
00137     for ( long i = 0; i < N; i++ )
00138     {
00139         asm volatile ( "NOP" );
00140         FPGA_BegWrite ();
00141         FPGA_Write( i, i );
00142         FPGA_BegRead ();
00143         (void volatile) FPGA_Read( i );
00144         }
00145     
00146     TRACE_INFO( "T5\n" );
00147     for ( long i = 0; i < N; i++ )
00148     {
00149         asm volatile ( "NOP" );
00150         FPGA_BegWrite ();
00151         FPGA_Write( i, i );
00152         FPGA_Write( i, i );
00153         FPGA_BegRead ();
00154         }
00155 
00156     TRACE_INFO( "T6\n" );
00157     }
00158 #endif

00160 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00161 // FPGA Interrupt Handler Task
00162 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00163 portTASK_FUNCTION( FPGA_IrqTasklet, pvParameters )
00164 {
00165     (void) pvParameters; // The parameters are not used.
00166 
00167     taskENTER_CRITICAL();
00168     
00169     TRACE_INFO( "%XPI Main Task\n" );
00170 
00171     // Configure FPGA interrupt. Interrupt will be later enabled when entering 
00172     // FPGA communication mode.
00173     //
00174     AT91F_PMC_EnablePeriphClock
00175     (
00176         AT91C_BASE_PMC, // PIO controller base address
00177         uint( 1 ) << AT91C_ID_IRQ0
00178         );
00179 
00180     AT91F_AIC_ConfigureIt
00181     (
00182         AT91C_BASE_AIC,
00183         AT91C_ID_IRQ0,
00184         AT91C_AIC_PRIOR_HIGHEST,
00185         AT91C_AIC_SRCTYPE_EXT_LOW_LEVEL,
00186         ISR_Wrapper_FPGA
00187         );
00188 
00189     taskEXIT_CRITICAL();
00190 
00191     uint oldState = AT91F_PIO_GetInput( AT91C_BASE_PIOA );
00192 
00193     for( ;; )
00194     {
00195         // Calculate elapsed time and decrement timer
00196         //
00197         xpi.On_Timer (); // Decrement timer
00198 
00199         if ( ! fpgaEvent.Wait( 1, xpi.GetNextTimeout () ) )
00200         {
00201             // Calculate elapsed time and decrement timer
00202             //
00203             xpi.On_Timer ();
00204             
00205             // Post xpi.Goto(IDLE) handler
00206             //
00207             xpi.StartTransmissionIfIdle ();
00208 
00209             // Check PUSHBUTTON1
00210             //
00211             uint newState =  AT91F_PIO_GetInput( AT91C_BASE_PIOA );
00212 
00213             if ( ISSET( oldState, PUSHBUTTON1 ) && ISCLEARED( newState, PUSHBUTTON1 ) )
00214             {
00215                 }
00216 
00217             oldState = newState;
00218 
00219             continue;
00220             }
00221 
00222         int irq_count = 10000; // protection from IRQ flood
00223         while( --irq_count >= 0 )
00224         {
00225             // Post xpi.Goto(IDLE) handler
00226             //
00227             xpi.StartTransmissionIfIdle ();
00228 
00229             // Set Page 0 and IRQ status bitmap
00230             //
00231             taskENTER_CRITICAL ();
00232             FPGA_BegWrite ();
00233             FPGA_Write( XPI_W_PAGE_ADDR, 0 ); // Page 0
00234             FPGA_BegRead ();
00235             uint irq_list = FPGA_Read( XPI_R_INT_REQUEST );
00236             taskEXIT_CRITICAL ();
00237 
00238             if ( ! irq_list )
00239                 break;
00240 
00241             if ( irq_list & XPI_IRQ_CTXE ) // CTXE FIFO
00242             {
00243                 xpi.On_CTXE ();
00244                 }
00245             if ( irq_list & XPI_IRQ_CTX ) // CTX FIFO
00246             {
00247                 xpi.On_CTX ();
00248                 }
00249             if ( irq_list & XPI_IRQ_CRX ) // CRX FIFO
00250             {
00251                 xpi.On_CRX ();
00252                 }
00253             if ( irq_list & XPI_IRQ_EIRQ ) // EIRQ FIFO
00254             {
00255                 xpi.On_EIRQ ();
00256                 }
00257             if ( irq_list & XPI_IRQ_FC ) // FC FIFO
00258             {
00259                 xpi.On_FC ();
00260                 }
00261             if ( irq_list & XPI_IRQ_PCM ) // PCM FIFO
00262             {
00263                 taskENTER_CRITICAL ();
00264                 FPGA_BegWrite ();
00265                 FPGA_Write( XPI_W_PAGE_ADDR, 2 ); // Page 2
00266                 FPGA_BegRead ();
00267                 
00268                 // Collect 160 samples and send them as a packet to host.
00269                 // At the same time read-in RPCM data from the last RPCM packet.
00270                 // int octet = FPGA_Read( XPI_R_P2_PCM_R1 );
00271                 
00272                 // Acknowledge interrupt
00273                 FPGA_Read( XPI_R_P2_PCM_ACK );
00274                 taskEXIT_CRITICAL ();
00275                 }
00276             }
00277 
00278         // Check IRQ flood
00279         //
00280         if ( irq_count < 0 )
00281         {
00282             taskENTER_CRITICAL ();
00283             tracef( 2, "SEVERE ERROR: Too many interrupts\n" );
00284             taskEXIT_CRITICAL ();
00285             xpi.ResetFPGA ();
00286             }
00287         else
00288         {
00289             // Enable FPGA interrupt
00290             //
00291             AT91F_AIC_EnableIt( AT91C_BASE_AIC, AT91C_ID_IRQ0 );
00292             }
00293         }
00294     }
